TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit MembershipUserCollection extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.ICollection, class System.Collections.IEnumerable

remarks.format:
## Remarks A MembershipUserCollection is returned from the <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.GetAllUsers%2A>, <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.FindUsersByName%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.FindUsersByEmail%2A> methods of the <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership?displayProperty=fullName> class. The MembershipUserCollection objects returned by the <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.GetAllUsers%2A>, <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.FindUsersByName%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.FindUsersByEmail%2A> methods contain a snapshot of user information in the membership data store. That is, changes to the membership user information in a MembershipUserCollection are not reflected in the membership data store. To modify membership user information in the membership data store, use the <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.UpdateUser%2A>, <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.CreateUser%2A> and <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.DeleteUser%2A> methods of the <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership?displayProperty=fullName> class.
> [!NOTE] > If you are not familiar with the membership features of ASP.NET, see [Introduction to Membership](../Topic/Introduction%20to%20Membership.md) before continuing. For a list of other topics related to membership, see [Managing Users by Using Membership](../Topic/Managing%20Users%20by%20Using%20Membership.md).
## Examples The following code example returns a list of membership users with a count of the number of users currently online. For an example of an ASP.NET application configured to use membership, see the <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership> class.
[!code-vb[System.Web.Security.SqlMembershipProvider#5](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.security.me_3_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[System.Web.Security.SqlMembershipProvider#5](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.security.me_3_1.aspx)]

Docs.summary: Creates a new, empty membership user collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipUserCollection> is constructed by membership provider implementers and returned from the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider.GetAllUsers%2A> and <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider.FindUsersByName%2A> methods of the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider> abstract class.
## Examples The following code example shows a sample <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider.GetAllUsers%2A> implementation.

remarks.format:

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.IEnumerator GetEnumerator() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets an enumerator that can iterate through the membership user collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Enumerators only allow reading the data in the collection. Enumerators cannot be used to modify the underlying collection. For more information, see <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator>.
## Examples The following code example uses the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator> returned from the GetEnumerator method to iterate through a <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipUserCollection>.
[!code-cs[System.Web.Security.MembershipUserCollection#7](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.security.me_23_1.aspx)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Security.MembershipUserCollection#7](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.security.me_23_1.aspx)]

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the membership user collection is thread safe.
Docs.value: Always because thread-safe membership user collections are not supported.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Application code does not normally use this property.

Docs.summary: Gets the membership user in the collection referenced by the specified user name.
Docs.value: A object representing the user specified by .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipUser> object returned by Item property contains a snapshot of user information in the membership data store. That is, changes to the membership user information in the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipUserCollection> are not reflected in the membership data store. To modify membership user information in the membership data store, use the <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.UpdateUser%2A>, <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.CreateUser%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.DeleteUser%2A> methods.
## Examples The following code example displays all membership user names in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox> and shows specific membership information for the selected user name.
[!code-cs[System.Web.Security.MembershipUserCollection#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.security.me_8_1.aspx)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Security.MembershipUserCollection#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.security.me_8_1.aspx)]

Docs.param: The user name of the object to remove from the collection.
Docs.summary: Removes the membership user object with the specified user name from the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void SetReadOnly() cil managed

Docs.summary: Makes the contents of the membership user collection read-only.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The contents of a <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipUserCollection> are considered read-only, as they are a snapshot of the membership user information in the membership data store. Membership user information is modified using the <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.UpdateUser%2A>, <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.CreateUser%2A> and <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.DeleteUser%2A> methods. The SetReadOnly method marks the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipUserCollection> as read-only so that <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipUser> objects cannot be added to or removed from the collection. Property values for the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipUser> objects are not marked as read-only. That is, you can modify the property values of a <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipUser> in the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipUserCollection> regardless of whether the collection has been marked as read-only by the SetReadOnly method.
## Examples The following code example returns all of the users from the membership data store. The <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipUserCollection> returned is marked as read-only based on a `Boolean` parameter specified by the caller.
[!code-cs[System.Web.Security.MembershipUserCollection#5](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.security.me_5_1.aspx)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Security.MembershipUserCollection#5](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.security.me_5_1.aspx)]

Docs.value: Always , because synchronization of membership user collections is not supported.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Application code does not normally use this property.
